I love this game. It is a great simulation game. It can be improved though.  Pros: -Addictive -Can simulate seasons in 30 minutes or so -Simple but fun recruiting Cons: -A bit buggy (there's a bug at the moment where I'm in the year 2033 and can't advance ahead of the draft. All it shows is the draft board screen and doesn't advance.) -Unrealistic scoring at times (Its not uncommon for some games to end in 125-124. I've have multiple games where my team scored 125 and only allowed 50.)  Overall, this game is legitimatly good. If they can fix some bugs and if they can add things like an NIT tournament, then this game will be a must own. The potential for a great app is here. Just fix it the scoring and bugs

The simulation makes no sense at all. I am in Year 16 right now. 13 of those 16 years i have had a full team of 8 10s and 2 9s. One year i even had 9 10s and 1 9ovr and still lost in the final four to a team with 3 9s, a couple 8s and rest 7s and 6s. Out of 13-14 years of being the number 1 team and having at least 8 10s on my team, i have only won 4 titles while going to about 10-12 total. And all the losses i have come from big time inferior opponents that have just a few 9s and the rest of thier team rounds out with 8s-5s and somehow still beat my team of 10s by 15 points. Obviously, i'm not asking to win every year, but having the best team for 13 out of 16 years and making the title game at least 12 of those 16 years should result in more than just 4 titles. I am losing the final game over 60% of the time even while having the superior team by far. While i love the game and it's potential. The simulation is definetly a complaint area.

Some good features, but some major problems.  Firstly, tournament selection makes no sense.  I went 14-4 in the SEC, won the conference tourney, beat several ranked teams, and ended up in the play-in game against an undefeated ACC Champion.  In that same season, #1 ranked, undefeated Purdue was in a play-in game.  Good sim, but programmer has zero understanding of conf weighting and rpi.  Recruiting has similar problems.  I can be well in the lead for a revruit and lose him out of nowhere to a rinky dink school.  Both recruiting and tourney selection should weight toward major conferences.

Incredibly addictive. Also incredibly frustrating. Seems there's no way to win. You can assemble the best college basketball team to ever grace the court and still get knocked out in the Sweet 16 or Elite 8 by a team ranked #18 with two guys who score 30+ points a game regardless of who they're matched up against.  The last straw for me was leading in recruiting on 5 players in the top 30 of a recruiting class and all those players committing to other schools despite my team leading in recruiting points by over 100 on each of them. If anyone has ever won the national championship in this game, I'd be interested in hearing how. I literally played 11 seasons on it and made it to the Round of 16 or 8 every time, only to be knocked out by some crappy school ranked in the teens or twenties. Play this if you need to put a hole in a wall somewhere.

This is great to pass the time. The interface is extremely user friendly and easy to understand. I love how simple the design is as well and have been a big fan of simulation sports games for a long time now.   My only concerns are that the practice modes could use a little bit of enhancing or directions. They just seem really behind compared to the rest of the game. I end up simming every practice because of that. The other thing is the difficulty could be increased. I can consistently bring a 1 star team to a 4 star team with 40+ wins within 5 years every time. I've taken the time to try a few different challenges to increase gameplay difficulty with the same results regardless if I go all offense, all defense, or never cut a player from the previous season.   Overall, for the price of the game it's definitely, hand down a 5 star game.

content: This game has all the potential to become a must have game if you love recruiting style games.  What I would suggest is that you should scale down the ratings so you can utilize the "potential" and "defense" more. I've had players with 5 potential that would grow more than a player with 10 potential. So what I would suggest is that you should down scale all recruits way lower so that they actually grow into great players because its more realistic that way. It will even utilize a new part of the game where you can find gems in a deep sea of recruits. I wouldn't just throw around the "10 overall" potential as in it would grow players to 10 overall. The defense stat is completely useless. When you go up against another great team it becomes a barnburner of a game. Its pretty much a race to who gets to 120 points first! You should make it tough for a player to get to 10 because that player should impact the game dramatically. A player with 10 offense should be that 40 points a game player as long as he was a relitively consistent player. So what I would suggest is that you start recruits stats alot lower so they arent so godly.  The draft isnt special at all due to the fact that there is 100+ 10 overall players so the scaling should easily be able to fix that.  There should be an absolute undisputable way to win the cup. I've had a team of mostly 10 overall players and lose to some random team because they had one good player that scored 45 points when all my players score 6-20 points each MAX because there is to many good players to match one good player. There no way this should happen when your team has very good defense?  All this would be fixed with downscaling the great recruits to 6 or 7 so they would grow each year on their potential or a super rare occasional 8 that everyone is trying to recruit.  Or maybe on a different note you could increase player rating to be out of 100 instead of 10 so it doesnt look so repetitive?   Please try these changes as in would make the game easier to be successful and realistic!
Great game, hard as hell for me to get a national championship

This is a great game but like others in the comments one complaint I have is how if you make all your players 10 on everything it is very hard to win all the way I have actually never won a championship this way. What I realized is that with an all 10 team is all 10 of my players are fighting for the points and I end up averaging just about 100 points a game doing this BUT if you even your roster out to have a couple 10s 9s and 8s it results in the most likely way to win the championship and when I have it setup this way I average 105 to 107 pts per game on the year. However nothing is guaranteed and you will not always be able to win it all. I have played probably 30 plus seasons on different teams trying out different methods and I have the most consistency with having a well rounded out team rather than all 10s for anyone wanting to win more championships! Great game guys I am addicted to this game! Oh and also 1 thing I really don't like is how if I am the players first choice team and have well over 2 or 3 hundred recruiting points than the next team they still don't pick me sometimes they do and sometimes they don't I feel like it shouldn't be this way though
It's a great game and love the progression. Just wish the controls were more responsive.
